verses.verse: To the chief Musician <S%H5329><s%> <S%H8764><s%>, to Jeduthun <S%H3038><s%>, A Psalm <S%H4210><s%> of David <S%H1732><s%>. Truly my soul <S%H5315><s%> waiteth <S%H1747><s%> upon 'Elohim <S%H430><s%>: from him cometh my salvation <S%H3444><s%>.
He only is my rock <S%H6697><s%> and my salvation <S%H3444><s%>; he is my defence <S%H4869><s%>; I shall not be greatly <S%H7227><s%> moved <S%H4131><s%> <S%H8735><s%>.

How long will ye imagine mischief <S%H2050><s%> <S%H8779><s%> against a man <S%H376><s%>? ye shall be slain <S%H7523><s%> <S%H8792><s%> all of you: as a bowing <S%H5186><s%> <S%H8803><s%> wall <S%H7023><s%> shall ye be, and as a tottering <S%H1760><s%> <S%H8803><s%> fence <S%H1447><s%>.

They only consult <S%H3289><s%> <S%H8804><s%> to cast him down <S%H5080><s%> <S%H8687><s%> from his excellency <S%H7613><s%>: they delight <S%H7521><s%> <S%H8799><s%> in lies <S%H3577><s%>: they bless <S%H1288><s%> <S%H8762><s%> with their mouth <S%H6310><s%>, but they curse <S%H7043><s%> <S%H8762><s%> inwardly <S%H7130><s%>. Selah <S%H5542><s%>.
My soul <S%H5315><s%>, wait <S%H1826><s%> <S%H8798><s%> thou only upon 'Elohim <S%H430><s%>; for my expectation <S%H8615><s%> is from him.
He only is my rock <S%H6697><s%> and my salvation <S%H3444><s%>: he is my defence <S%H4869><s%>; I shall not be moved <S%H4131><s%> <S%H8735><s%>.
In 'Elohim <S%H430><s%> is my salvation <S%H3468><s%> and my glory <S%H3519><s%>: the rock <S%H6697><s%> of my strength <S%H5797><s%>, and my refuge <S%H4268><s%>, is in 'Elohim <S%H430><s%>.

Trust <S%H982><s%> <S%H8798><s%> in him at all times <S%H6256><s%>; ye people <S%H5971><s%>, pour out <S%H8210><s%> <S%H8798><s%> your heart <S%H3824><s%> before <S%H6440><s%> him: 'Elohim <S%H430><s%> is a refuge <S%H4268><s%> for us. Selah <S%H5542><s%>.

Surely men <S%H120><s%> <S%H1121><s%> of low degree are vanity <S%H1892><s%>, and men <S%H376><s%> of high degree are a lie <S%H3577><s%>: to be laid <S%H5927><s%> <S%H8800><s%> in the balance <S%H3976><s%>, they are altogether <S%H3162><s%> lighter than vanity <S%H1892><s%>.

Trust <S%H982><s%> <S%H8799><s%> not in oppression <S%H6233><s%>, and become not vain <S%H1891><s%> <S%H8799><s%> in robbery <S%H1498><s%>: if riches <S%H2428><s%> increase <S%H5107><s%> <S%H8799><s%>, set <S%H7896><s%> <S%H8799><s%> not your heart <S%H3820><s%> upon them.

'Elohim <S%H430><s%> hath spoken <S%H1696><s%> <S%H8765><s%> once <S%H259><s%>; twice <S%H8147><s%> have I heard <S%H8085><s%> <S%H8804><s%> this <S%H2098><s%>; that power <S%H5797><s%> belongeth unto 'Elohim <S%H430><s%>.
Also unto thee, O YY <S%H136><s%>, belongeth mercy <S%H2617><s%>: for thou renderest <S%H7999><s%> <S%H8762><s%> to every man <S%H376><s%> according to his work <S%H4639><s%>.
